title: iPhone 16 Glowtime event: Live blog and last-minute rumors
content:
Macworld

Apple’s big iPhone day is nearly here! The Glowtime iPhone event will kick off at 10am PT Monday with a video keynote that introduces the biggest new products of the fall: the iPhone 16 and Apple Watch Series 10. And there may be a few surprises along the way as well, including new AirPods, an iPad mini, and maybe even “One more thing.” Here’s everything you need to know about the big show.

Glowtime event: How to watch

You can watch the keynote live on Apple.com or the TV app, or just watch the embedded YouTube video stream below:

Glowtime event: Latest news and rumors

Apple Store down: As expected, Apple has taken its online store down ahead of the Glowtime event.

EarPods discontinued: According to Aaron on X, Apple may retire its longstanding line of wired EarPods today.

AirPods Max 2: Mark Gurman of Bloomberg reports Apple will update its AirPods Max headphones today with “better noise cancellation, adaptive audio & USB-C.”

Sleep apnea tracking: Gurman reports that sleep apnea tracking will be a “major new health feature” of the new Apple Watches, but “may not be available on day one of the new model going on sale.”

No iPad mini: Gurman reports that Apple’s iPad mini update isn’t coming at this event but rather is “on deck for Apple’s October event alongside the M4 Macs.”

Better sensors: 9to5Mac reports that the Apple Watch Series 10 and Ultra 3 will sport upgraded EKG and heart-rate sensors “that will unlock new features and provide more accurate results.”

No Apple Watch Ultra: Gurman claims the Apple Watch Ultra 3 might not arrive at the Glowtime event, but rather the Ultra 2 may merely get a new color.

Delayed Apple Watch SE: Gurman also says he “wouldn’t rule out a delay to the new Watch SE,” which implies that it may get an announcement but not ship for several weeks.

Glowtime event: What’s coming

iPhone 16 and 16 Plus: Apple’s base-level iPhones are expected to get a host of new features, including the iPhone 15 Pro’s Action button, a new Capture button, an A18 processor, Apple Intelligence, and a new vertical camera alignment. And of course, some new colors too that are noticeably brighter than last year’s.

iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max: The high-end phones get larger screens (6.32 inches and 6.9 inches), a faster chip (A18 Pro), and better cameras. And the iPhone 15 Pro Max’s enhanced zoom lens should be coming to the smaller model as well.

Apple Watch Series 10: The Glowtime event is being held on September 10, exactly 10 years after the Apple Watch made its debut at the iPhone 6 event, so it’s no secret that Apple is planning one of the biggest updates ever. Rumors say the first-ever redesign could be on the way, with larger screens, a thinner body, and flatter edges.

Apple Watch SE 3: After four years of basically the same watch, the 3rd-gen SE looks to be a major overhaul, with a plastic body and a lower price.

Apple Watch Ultra 3: Not much new is expected other than a new chip and maybe a second color option.

AirPods: All of Apple’s AirPods are long overdue for an update and several are candidates for this event. A new budget model could replace the ancient 2nd-gen model with a lower price; a 4th-gen update could bring noise-cancellation and a new design; and an AirPods Max refresh could also be on the way.

iPad mini: Not much new is expected from the next mini update other than a new chip and more RAM to make it Apple Intelligence-ready.

Glowtime event: Live blog

When the event kicks off, we’ll be updating live as everything is announced. In the meantime, stay tuned for any news and rumors we get ahead of the event:

Apple Store Scandinavia grand opening: Apple has announced that its newest store in the Mall of Scandinavia will have its grand opening on Friday, September 20, a strong indication that the iPhone 16 will launch on that day.
